speaker: REPAIRMAN
line: Get away. Oh, damn it! A bee stung me, ay? Well, now... don't you all take the cake? Does your mom ever mix you up?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: I've come to you at great risk... I mean you no harm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he knows about your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do I know you're for real?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: I can explain everything to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: First I want you to come somewhere with me. I want you to come with me to see my mother.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay out of his way, Scully, he doesn't want to hurt you. You can't use your gun!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop right there, sir!

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, get the car! This way. Damn. This way.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey! Jeremiah! Jeremiah, stop! What are you doing?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: There'll be more right behind him!

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't leave here!

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: They'll kill me!

speaker: MULDER
line: I need your help! My mother is dying!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! Mulder! Mulder! Mulder!

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Where are they going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh... I don't know...

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: I need to know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Please, I don't know.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: They know where to find us. They'll be waiting for us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: Your government men. They'll be waiting at the hospital with your mother.

speaker: MULDER
line: What can they do? We're working in the light. They, they can't stop us without exposure, without consequence.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: You have to understand something. I must perish. Whatever the consequences to that end, they are incalculable to the preservation of the larger plan.

speaker: MULDER
line: The larger plan? You mean colonization.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: Hegemony, Mister Mulder. A new origin of species.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't understand...

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: I can show you.

speaker: MULDER
line: My mother is dying. I need to take you to see her right now.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: And if they are waiting for us? If they're willing to kill me and then face the consequence of their actions and stand before your ineffectual justice system, I will be dead. I won't be able to save your mother. The work will go on. The plan will continue to be executed. Or you can stop it.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can I stop it?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: I can take you to a place, show you the work in progress, where you can see...

speaker: MULDER
line: No, look, there's no time!

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: Where you can see your sister!

speaker: PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND; 4
line: 55 AM

speaker: ELDER
line: He isn't coming.

speaker: CSM
line: I told you.

speaker: ELDER
line: Then where is he?

speaker: CSM
line: I don't know. Certainly, he anticipated we'd be here, waiting.

speaker: ELDER
line: Unless we have a security leak.

speaker: CSM
line: Who?

speaker: ELDER
line: I've come in receipt of some pictures... of your visit to Mrs. Mulder's summer house. Were you aware you were being photographed?

speaker: CSM
line: By whom?

speaker: ELDER
line: I believe that can be determined by a simple planting of information... to see where that information flows.

speaker: CSM
line: What information?

speaker: ELDER
line: That Mrs. Mulder's life is in danger... that left unprotected... she may come to an unnatural end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, it's me. Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm right where you left me, Mulder. I'm sitting here in my car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because you wouldn't answer your phone and because I didn't know what else to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you okay, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I'm fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen to me, there's going to be... there's going to be people looking for me. They're going to think they can get to me through you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no, hold on, just, just listen for a second, Scully. I need you to do something for me. I had to steal a car from an airport in Alberta. There's going to be a record of me going through Canadian customs and I need you to cover my tracks. I also need you to know that I'm okay, Scully. I'm fine. Okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he's coming after you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The man you left for dead. He's alive.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: That's it for the gas.

speaker: MULDER
line: How much further from here?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: About twenty miles. Maybe half that... on foot over those hills.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I heard that you were looking for me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's been some concern about you and Agent Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're fine, sir. We've been searching for this man, Jeremiah Smith.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Did you find him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I received a memo from you that there's more confusion about this man... that the Social Security administration has five men with this name working in branch offices around the country... with identical photo I.D.s. I ran a check on these men. All five have not reported to work in three days. Now, would you or Agent Mulder like to let me in on what it is your suspicions are?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid we haven't exactly formulated any clear suspicions, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, we have, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: We were able to download the hard drive data from each of the five missing men's social security workstations, and in each case, we found an enormous amount of files and data that cannot be identified. Do not correspond with any kind of accounting or document collection done as normal departmental business. The data was all locked in password files.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How much of it is there?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Enough to fill seven ten-gigabyte hard drives, roughly, uh, a billion entries.

speaker: SKINNER
line: It appears to be some kind of personal record-keeping or accounting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could it be some kind of cryptograph?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: If it is, I can't crack it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd like to get a copy of a portion of this. I might be able to figure it out.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Seriously?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe. There's somebody I want to run it by.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I think, sir, this is more along my field of expertise.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to this man?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: I wouldn't touch the body, Mister Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's a work order here. It's for yesterday. He's only been here a little more than twenty-four hours. You know what killed him, don't you?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: It's not much further. You're looking at the future, Mister Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: A flowering shrub. But it's specific epithet can't be found in any of your taxonomic charts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Being grown for what?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: Pollen.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this? What's going on here?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: What did I tell you, Mister Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: That looks just like my sister. But that's not possible. She's no older than the day she was taken. Samantha? Samantha! Samantha? Samantha? Samantha? Samantha, it's me. It's me, Fox, your brother. Do you remember me? What's wrong with her?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: She has no language.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: She's a drone, Mister Mulder. A worker.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: There's more you should see so that you might understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd they get here?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: They're stationed here. They're part of an agrarian work force.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who takes care of them?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: They take care of themselves. Parenting is unnecessary... a needless division of energy.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're clones.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: Serial ovotypes. Have you seen enough, Mister Mulder? We can't stay around here much longer. I'll go see if I can find some gas.

speaker: X
line: Open the door, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know I was here?

speaker: X
line: I've been trying to reach Agent Mulder. I watched you enter the building. Where is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: X
line: I have information for him. A matter that would concern him greatly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Concern him how?

speaker: X
line: Concerning his mother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Has something happened to her?

speaker: X
line: No. No, not yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is she in danger?

speaker: X
line: I prefer to speak with Agent Mulder directly. Let me just say she is unprotected.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From whom? From whom?

speaker: X
line: If you want to involve yourself, Agent Scully, you might do well to give this information to your partner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not until you give me some information first. These are data entries taken from social security records...

speaker: X
line: You're going in the wrong direction, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All beginning with the letters S-E-P. You know what these are. Confirm or deny.

speaker: X
line: Smallpox eradication program.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Smallpox?

speaker: X
line: Don't unlock doors you're not prepared to go through, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: X
line: Leave it alone. Protect the mother.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's coming with us.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: You can't do this. She's not your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then who is she?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: You have a chance here to understand something so much greater, to comprehend it, to expose it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then explain it to me. Explain it to me now! Bees.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: It's an apiary.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are bees what killed that man we found?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's probably not a good idea to hide in there.

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: No, you have no immunity to them.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you do? Somebody lead me, I can't see anything. Is that the only way out?

speaker: JEREMIAH SMITH
line: We've walked into our own trap.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you busy, Agent Pendrell?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: No, I was just, uh...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good, because I think I've made some headway on this data. Can you call up the files?

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Yeah. I got to tell you, I've gotten nowhere.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "SEP." Smallpox Eradication Program.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Smallpox? How'd you figure that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I got lucky, but the key is in this first string of letters.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Twenty-letter strings. Thirty different variations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You say "a twenty-letter code" to any scientist, and they immediately think "protein amino acid sequence..." which is what this turned out to be.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Protein sequence for what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cowpox virus... the virus used to inoculate humans against smallpox.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Okay, right. These guys were keeping records of smallpox inoculations. Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I haven't worked that out yet, but the big question is this second alphanumeric string. Fifteen digits.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Yeah, I checked. Each one is different... an infinite number of variations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: An inventory.

speaker: PENDRELL
line: Of what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Of us.

speaker: SECOND SENIOR AGENT
line: With all due respect, Agent Scully... it looks like something from the Hubble telescope.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually, it's an image created by what's called a confocal microscope. You're looking at a three-dimensional picture of the location of a protein. In this case, cowpox structural protein number six. It's one of the inoculants used in smallpox vaccines.

speaker: SENIOR FBI AGENT
line: Where'd it come from?

speaker: SCULLY
line: From me. I had a biopsy taken from the smallpox vaccination scar on my upper arm. Through a process called immunohisto chemical staining and through the addition of an antibody for the cowpox virus six, I was able to get this picture of the location of a protein... a single, non-random, protein pattern.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not a scientist, Agent Scully, and I don't know that many people in this room...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I'm saying is that I think this protein is a tag... some kind of genetic marker that was applied to me when I was inoculated against smallpox as a child.

speaker: SENIOR FBI AGENT
line: Why you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not just me... all of us... quite possibly anybody who's been inoculated over the past fifty years.

speaker: SECOND SENIOR AGENT
line: Agent Scully... frankly, this sounds like something we would might have expected from Agent Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I had my doubts... and I'm still not certain. But I performed the same procedure on Agent Pendrell. The location of the protein from his biopsy should be identical to mine, but it's slightly different, which might correspond to the alphanumeric entries collected by the men at the, uh, social security administration.

speaker: SKINNER
line: So what you're saying, Agent Scully, is we're being tagged, catalogued and inventoried? By who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, but it would have to be a government agency.

speaker: SENIOR FBI AGENT
line: And to what purpose?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know that either, and I think the only man who might be able to give us that information is Jeremiah Smith.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, can I see you outside for a moment? Alone. Do you realize what you're promoting in there? You're rounding these people up in the middle of the work day to imply that there's...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I am a scientist, sir. What I'm promoting in there is reductive evidence. It's the reason I believe I was assigned to the X-Files in the first place, is it not? To put Agent Mulder's work to the test of science? Excuse me. Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, where are you right now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm in Skinner's office, where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm still in Canada, but I'm catching a plane soon. I need you to meet me on the other end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just tell me where.

speaker: MULDER
line: At the hospital where my mother is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I don't...

speaker: MULDER
line: Her life depends upon me and my party getting there safely.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Jeremiah Smith... and someone else. I'm going to need some protection, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, believe me, Mulder, you're going to have it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's a lot of people who want to talk to Jeremiah Smith.

speaker: MULDER
line: They'll get their chance.

speaker: MULDER
line: Please, you can't kill him...he can't die.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: He must.

speaker: MULDER
line: That girl is my sister.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: He shows you pieces, but tells you nothing of the whole... because he's inconsequential... a traitor to the project.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kill me, let them go.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: You'd trade your life for his?

speaker: MULDER
line: For my mother's.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Everything dies.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Five hours we're out here swinging in the wind, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Something's wrong. Something happened.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You don't have any way of getting hold of him?

speaker: NURSE
line: This is beginning to seriously compromise our ability to treat patients.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God... Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't... there's nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, dear... no... he's freezing. He's in, you're in shock, Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: She'll never know. She'll never know...

speaker: MULDER
line: I could have saved her, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As long as she's lying here, you can't give up on her. I don't care what the doctors say.

speaker: MULDER
line: I had one chance... and I let it slip away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We don't know that, Mulder. You can't blame yourself for what you could only hope.

speaker: MULDER
line: He took me to a place with green fields. And I saw my sister. She was just a little girl. I've seen too many things not to believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've seen things too. But there are answers to be found now. We have hope that there's a place to start. That's what I believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: You put such faith in your science, Scully. But... the things I've seen, science provides no place to start.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing happens in contradiction to nature, only in contradiction to what we know of it. And that's a place to start. That's where the hope is.

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel like I came so close.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I feel it too. I know it.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was warned... By a man we both know... who I believe knows the truth... who can lead us to a place to start.

speaker: COVARRUBIAS
line: Mister Mulder. My name is Marita Covarrubias. I'm the assistant to the Special Representative.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, was he able to review the material that I sent him?

speaker: COVARRUBIAS
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: And will he see me?

speaker: COVARRUBIAS
line: I'm afraid he's been called into something important. Can I ask who sent you here, Mister Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: A friend. You know, I've been inquiring with each of the special representatives all month about the farmland in Canada. I've been trying to get some answers and all I've gotten are dead ends.

speaker: COVARRUBIAS
line: Well, I can tell you that farm has been abandoned. The crops you described were left to die, but they have been identified as ginseng. No evidence of beehives or bee husbandry was found. I know it's not the answer you wanted. No, I, uh...

speaker: COVARRUBIAS
line: Can I ask why this is so important to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've suffered... I've suffered some very personal... losses recently, and... I was... I was hoping... That, um...

speaker: COVARRUBIAS
line: Not everything dies, Mister Mulder.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: I need to know the reasons why this should be.

speaker: CSM
line: So that the work may continue. So that the project may proceed unabated by removing an unnecessary obstacle.

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: What obstacle?

speaker: CSM
line: Agent Mulder, actually. If his mother were to die, he would...

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: He what?

speaker: CSM
line: You see... the fiercest enemy is the man who has nothing left to lose. And we both know how valuable Agent Mulder is to the equation.
